response:
reasoning='1.  Interior ROI pixels
   • Polygon (2,2)-(2,7)-(7,7)-(7,2) is an axis-aligned 5×5 square, but only rows/cols strictly greater than 2 and strictly less than 7 are interior.  Hence rows 3–6 and columns 3–6 (0-based) → 16 interior pixels.
   • Intensities (row-wise):
     [30, 33, 36, 39,
      32, 35, 38, 41,
      34, 37, 40, 43,
      36, 39, 42, 45]

2.  First–order statistics
   • n = 16, Σx = 600  →  mean μ = 600 / 16 = 37.5.
   • Σ(x−μ)² = 260  →  sample variance s² = 260 / (16−1) = 17.3333.
   • Σ(x−μ)³ = 0  →  skewness = 0.
   • Σ(x−μ)^4 = 9 377.  Central 4th moment m4 = 9 377 / 16 = 586.0625.
     Using Fisher’s unbiased excess-kurtosis formula
        g2 = [n(n+1)/( (n−1)(n−2)(n−3) )] · (m4 / s²²) 
             − [3 (n−1)² / ((n−2)(n−3))]
        = (272/2730)·1.950651 − 675/182 ≈ −3.5144.

3.  GLCM (offset [0,1])
   • Horizontal pairs within ROI (12 pairs):
     (30,33), (33,36), (36,39)×2, (32,35), (35,38), (38,41),
     (34,37), (37,40), (40,43), (39,42), (42,45)
   • Each |i−j| = 3, so |i−j|² = 9 for every pair.
   • Normalised probability p = count / 12; total probability Σp = 1.
   • Contrast = Σ|i−j|²·p(i,j) = 9·1 = 9.

4.  Rounded (4 d.p.) results
   Mean = 37.5000
   Variance = 17.3333
   Skewness = 0.0000
   Kurtosis = −3.5144
   Contrast = 9.0000' config=RadiomicsOutput(mean=37.5, variance=17.3333, skewness=0.0, kurtosis=-3.5144, contrast=9.0)
evaluation_result:
Mean intensity value of the ROI is wrong.
Sample variance of intensity values in the ROI is wrong.
Skewness of intensity distribution in the ROI is correct.
Excess kurtosis of intensity distribution in the ROI is wrong.
GLCM contrast feature computed from ROI pixels is correct.
